name: 陳怡靜
objective:
我們使用的方塊文字，以形寓意的獨立形構，已是世界文明的獨特瑰寶。本課程將從六書結構、文字流變、文字的文化意涵、文字的藝術觀等四個面向，切入認識中國文字與文化。

The pictographic system, an independent structure to represent meanings through word forms, has been considered a unique treasure in the world civilization. This course discusses the six morphological structures, the history and development, the cultural representation and the artistic functions of the written words in the Chinese language. 
This course provides an in-depth exploration of Shuowen Jiezi (說文解字), the foundational dictionary of Chinese characters by Xu Shen (許慎) during the Eastern Han dynasty. Students will study its structure, principles, and influence on Chinese linguistics and culture, gaining insights into character formation and the evolution of Chinese writing.
schedule:
Week 1: Overview of Shuowen Jiezi
Week 2: Structure and Methodology
Week 3: Radical-based Classification
Week 4:Pictographs (象形)
Week 5:Ideograms (指事) and Compound Ideograms (會意)
Week 6:Phono-semantic Compounds (形聲)
Week 7: Semantic Extension (轉注) and Loan Characters (假借)
Week 8: Historical Development of Chinese Writing
Week 9: Midterm Review & Assessment
Week 10: Insights into Ancient Chinese Culture
Week 11: Shuowen Jiezi’s Impact on Modern Linguistics
Week 12: Case Studies of Key Characters
Week 13: Reinterpreting Shuowen Jiezi in Modern Contexts
Week 14: Critiques and Limitations of Shuowen Jiezi
Week 15: Digital Tools and Resources
Week 16: Student-Led Analysis of Chosen Characters
Week 17: Review and Reflection
Week 18: Final Assessment
